{{see also|2011 Iranian protests}}
 
The 32nd anniversary of the [[Iranian Revolution]] was said to have had a low turnout on 11 February 2011. (The state-run ''[[Kayhan]]'' newspaper claimed a 50 million turnout, despite Iran having a population of only 75 million.) At the behest of [[Mir-Hossein Moussavi]] and [[Mehdi Karroubi]], opposition leaders called for nationwide protest marches for 14 February. Rumours suggested that the protesters would include university students, lorry drivers and gold merchants from across the country under the umbrella opposition known as the [[2009â2010 Iranian election protests|Green movement]] in what was seen as an inspiration of events from Egypt and Tunisia. The [[Army of the Guardians of the Islamic Revolution|Revolutionary Guard]] said it would forcefully confront protesters.<ref>{{cite web|author=D. Parvaz |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/02/2011212162526150718.html |title=Iran opposition 'planning protests' - Middle East |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date= |accessdate=2011-02-13}}</ref> Opposition activists and aides to Mousavi and Karroubi had been arrested in the days before the protests.
The 32nd anniversary of the [[Iranian Revolution]] was said to have had a low turnout on 11 February 2011. (The state-run ''[[Kayhan]]'' newspaper claimed a 50 million turnout, despite Iran having a population of only 75 million.) At the behest of [[Mir-Hossein Moussavi]] and [[Mehdi Karroubi]], opposition leaders called for nationwide protest marches for 14 February. Rumours suggested that the protesters would include university students, lorry drivers and gold merchants from across the country under the umbrella opposition known as the [[2009â2010 Iranian election protests|Green movement]] in what was seen as an inspiration of events from Egypt and Tunisia. The [[Army of the Guardians of the Islamic Revolution|Revolutionary Guard]] said it would forcefully confront protesters.<ref>{{cite web|author=D. Parvaz |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/02/2011212162526150718.html |title=Iran opposition 'planning protests' - Middle East |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date= |accessdate=2011-02-13}}</ref> Opposition activists and aides to Mousavi and Karroubi had been arrested in the days before the protests.
